title: Rare disease drug firm Healx founded by Viagra creator raises $56m
text:
A rare disease drugs firm co-founded by the discoverer of Viagra has raised $56m (£44m) to use artificial intelligence for finding new medicines.

Healx uses AI to examine potential beneficial side effects of existing treatments which could also treat rare ailments.

The firm was co-founded in 2014 by David Brown, who discovered Viagra in the 1990s as a side effect of medicine for high blood pressure. It started as a project at the University of Cambridge.

Dr Brown said: “We're taking safe drugs that are already optimised, provided the potency is good enough, we can go straight to the clinic.”

Healx raised the latest cash from investors including Skype billionaire Niklas Zennström’s fund Atomico...
description: A rare disease drugs firm co-founded by the discoverer of Viagra has raised $56m (£44m) to use artificial intelligence for finding new medicines.
